block.comment: This sprite is hidden because it draws from the end of the pencil sprite. It does not want to be seen drawing because it then appears that the pencil is doing the work.
The pen will stop drawing when the user says stop.
The pen will start drawing if the user says start.

custom-block.l: What pen colour do you want?
custom-block.comment: It does not say the text because the sprite is hidden. However, broadcasting text uses the pencil sprite to say messages.

custom-block.l: What pen colour do you want?

block.comment: If the user wants a rubber, they can change they pen colour to white which will look like it is erasing the image.

custom-block.l: This colour is not recognised.
This colour is not recognised.

block.comment: The user can instruct a change in pen colour. They will state wich colour they want.

custom-block.l: What size of pen do you want?
What size of pen do you want?
This is not a pen size.
This is not a pen size.

block.comment: The user can decide what pen size they want. Then they can state a number to determine the size.
The microphone is always actively listening out for instructions.
When the broadcast is received, the hidden sprite move to where the tip of the pencil is so that it appears as if the pencil is drawing.
When this broadcast is received, then pen goes up because this is the sprite that is doing the drawing, not the pencil sprite which recieves the instruction.

custom-block.l: Are you left or right handed?

block.l: L for left handed and R for right handed:

custom-block.l: This is an invalid answer.

block.comment: This sets the costume to look like a pencil. Which imitates using a pencil in real life.

custom-block.comment: This function asks the user which hand they want to paint with so the wrist can be tracked.

block.comment: They will stop painting when they say 'finish'.
The pencil is hidden so users can view the picture without the pencil obscuring their view.
This sprite tells the hidden sprite to put up the pen because if the user want to edit, they need to get the pen in the right position before drawing again.

custom-block.comment: This asks whether the user wants to edit their painting more. if so, they can continue painting.

block.comment: The user can carry on editing their painting if they say they are not happy with it.
This does the same as for when the had is left but for the right handed users.

custom-block.s: speak %txt %br with pitch %n %br with rate %n %br with voice %n %br with volume %n %br in language %txt %br when finished do %cmdRing with the message %br wait %b before doing the next command
custom-block.l: Screen shot your image to save it.
custom-block.comment: This reminds the user that they can screen shot their image if they want to keep it,

block.l: Screen shot your image to save it.

block.comment: When the hidden sprite needs to say something. The message is broadcast so this visible sprite can say it so the message can be viewed.
The microphone is always active to listen out for if the user wants to finish painting when it hears 'finish'.

block-definition.s: Listen to the microphone $nl %'handle response' when recognition completes $nl but if error %'handle error' with error message
block-definition.comment: Listens to the microphone for speech. The first script is run with the recognized text unless an error is encountered then the second script is called with text describing the error.

custom-block.l: start_speech_recognition

block-definition.comment: Reports the first voice number that matches all the arguments. If nothing matches tries to find a voice that matches the first argument.

custom-block.l: get_voice_number_matching

block-definition.s: speak %'message' $nl with pitch %'pitch' $nl with rate %'rate' $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl in language %'language' $nl when finished do %'what to do when finished' with the message $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Speaks 'message'. Optionally you can provide the pitch (a positive number), rate (a number between .1 and 2), voice (depends upon what voices are accessible from the browser - see 'get voices'), volume (a positive number), and language code or name. And a script to run when finished, This command will wait until it is finished if wait is true.

custom-block.l: speak

block-definition.comment: This reports a list of poses captured by the camera. There are 'pose property' reporters for inspecting the values in a pose.

custom-block.l: poses

block-definition.comment: This reports either the location of a body part as two numbrs between 0 and 100 or the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100.

input.options: confidence it is a person - 0 confidence there is a nose - 1 location of nose - 2 confidence there is a left eye - 3 location of left eye - 4 confidence there is a right eye - 5 location of right eye - 6 confidence there is a left ear - 7 location of left ear - 8 confidence there is a right ear - 9 location of right ear - 10 confidence there is a left shoulder - 11 location of leff shoulder - 12 confidence there is a right shoulder - 13 location of right shoulder - 14 confidence there is a left elbow - 15 location of left elbow - 16 confidence there is a right elbow - 17 location of right elbow - 18 confidence there is a left wrist - 19 location of left wrist - 20 confidence there is a right wrist - 21 location of right wrist - 22 confidence there is a left hip - 23 location of left hip - 24 confidence there is a right hip - 25 location of right hip - 26 confidence there is a left knee - 27 location of left knee - 28 confidence there is a right knee - 29 location of right knee - 30 confidence there is a left ankle - 31 location of left ankle - 32 confidence there is a right ankle - 33 location of right ankle - 34

block.comment: 'property name' ends with hypen and a number and this extracts that number. Add 0 to ensure it is a number and not text.
Confidence that there is a person at all.
Confidence score
Location extracted from [["x" 1] ["y" 2]]. Coordinates adjusted to go from 0 to 100.

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } else { let script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; script.addEventListener('error', function () { alert("Unable to load " + scrpt.src + ". Check your network connection."); }); if (window.location.hostname === 'localhost') { script.src = window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.host + "/ai/ecraft2learn-beta.js"; // notice this the beta version } else { script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; } script.addEventListener('load', function () { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); }); document.head.appendChild(script); }

if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } if (!no_warning) { alert("Any eCraft2Learn command must be run before the " + function_name + " reporter."); } return 0;

block-definition.comment: Reports the last thing spoken or if there was an error the error message. Note that "no-speech" is an error message while if spoken it will be "no speech". NOTE that this waits for something to be spoken or enough time has passed.

custom-block.s: Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message
speak %txt %br with pitch %n %br with rate %n %br with voice %n %br with volume %n %br in language %txt %br when finished do %cmdRing with the message %br wait %b before doing the next command

custom-block.l: Are you happy with your artwork?

block.l: Are you happy with your artwork?

custom-block.s: poses %cmdRing %br wait %b before doing the next command

custom-block.l: location of left wrist - 20
confidence there is a left wrist - 19

custom-block.s: poses %cmdRing %br wait %b before doing the next command

custom-block.l: location of right wrist - 22
confidence there is a right wrist - 21
This is the Painting Program where you are able to draw in mid-air with your arm.
custom-block.comment: These are instructions for the commands the user can use in the program.

custom-block.l: Say 'colour' to change the colour of the pen. Then state the colour of your choosing.
Say 'size' to change the size of the pen, and then say the size number.
Say 'start' if you want to start painting, and 'stop' if you want to lift the pen off the page.
Say 'finish' when you have finished your painting.
Screen shot your picture to save it.

block-definition.comment: Returns only after eCraft2Learn library is loaded
Should only be called by Load eCraft2Learn library

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return true; } if (window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library) { return false; } window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library = true; let script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; if (window.location.hostname === 'localhost') { script.src = window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.host + "/ai/ecraft2learn-beta.js"; // notice this the beta version } else { script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; } document.head.appendChild(script); return false;

block-definition.s: poses %'process poses' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: This reports a list of poses captured by the camera. There are 'pose property' reporters for inspecting the values in a pose.

custom-block.l: poses

variable.name: text
variable.l: What size of pen do you want?
